intro: Ricinocarpos muricatus, commonly known as the rough-hair tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and woody stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Ricinocarpos muricatus is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
